name: Blackfellow Crevice
description:
Two known pitches, a possible third exists further downstream. The first is ~25m off a tree Creek Right into the crevice. The second is ~40m down the main pitch.

No existing natural anchors exist for this second pitch, however it can be descended by using ~90m of rope attached to the tree atop the first pitch. This option will only work for a bounce trip.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Can be done as a bounce trip (climb back up ropes).

If intending on a through trip, be prepared to build a natural anchor using rocks above the second pitch. Also be prepared for a possible 3rd pitch futher downstream. A possible exit may exist downstream up one of the ridges. Alternatively one could continue down the creek to the Casuarina camping area, however this would require a car shuffle.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
